name: Pilgrimage Village

reviews.text: This is a resort, we have just spent 5 days there after travelling through Vietnam with our teenage daughter, it was such a welcome relief to arrive and find this oasis amid chaos, we stepped through the front gate and were transported a million miles away from the outside world, all the staff are very professinal, friendly and very happy to talk to you in English (halted at times) but still quite acceptable. Everything is opulent, marble bathrooms, beautiful rooms, the spa centre is to die for, the food in the restaurant is the best we had throughout Vietnam, one thng I would like to see is some western food on the menu, it is all vietnamese which is fine because that's where you are but I was dying for a hamburger and there is really nothing in Hue that you can get anything decent. The resort is out of town, but they have a shuttle bus and are very accomodating in this regard, as we just wanted to chill out it was no problem, 2 swimming pools and the spa centre accomodated our 15 year old daughter quite nicely. Would definately reccomend if you are looking for something at the end of a trip trough Vietnam to "chill out".
reviews.title: fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked our stay at Pilgrimage Village after learning about the hotel through the Small Luxury Hotels of the World. The resort is absolutely gorgeous. Every detail is meticulously maintained to generate a garden paradise. We stayed in a honeymoon bungalow which included a number of useful perquisites including airport transfer, fruit basket, 20% off spa services, and 10% all other fees including dinner at their restaurant. The room was expansive and luxurious and the bathroom was so large as to be scandalous. The staff was corteous and diligent without being intrusive. One highlight was sitting on the balcony late at night listening to the rain fail into the lily pond and garden below.
reviews.title: Secluded paradise

reviews.text: We were overwhelmingly satisfied with our stay, but offer only a few nitpicking complaints:
reviews.title: Does not deserve the stars......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Charging small fees for various services that should most certainly be included in a luxury spa resort including $2/hr for use of their internet computer. $10 for use of their sauna/steam room/jacuzzi.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel with beautiful garden

reviews.text: - They offer to arrange guided boat tours of the Perfume River and tours of Hue. Their prices do not seem to be competitive with those you can easily obtain in town.
reviews.title: You'll love it!!

reviews.text: - Spa services are priced at Western levels.
reviews.title: Pilgrimage - pamper plus -ideal to rebuild travel stamina

likes.liked: — Friendly staff available 24/7 to assist, lovely rooms

reviews.text: Yes this hotel is all of 8 minutes by taxi from town, but if you need some down time, great food at reasonable prices (average dish in restaurant is approx. US $8) and wonderful accommodation and facilities, then this is the place. We were upgraded on arrival to a gorgeous room and own plunge pool. My husband and son spent time with the woodcarvers and created their own sculpture whilst I swam in the most dreamy pool. The next morning was complimentary tai chi class for all of us followed by sumptuous breakfast. What a wonderful place this is - really recommend it highly.
reviews.title: The most relaxing, rejuvenating experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place really is an oasis of calm near the city of Hue. It was out of season when we stayed so there were very few guests at the hotel. This meant we had the pool to ourselves most days. The bungalow we stayed in was huge and with a view over the pool. The bed and bathroom were of excellent quality. The grounds of Pilgrimage Village are also very well maintained and the staff were very friendly and attentive. The hotel is a short distance out of Hue but the courtesy bus makes access easy and taxis are very cheap also. This means you can combine the hustle and bustle of the city with a more relaxed, tranquil atmosphere. The rate we paid was unbelievably good (about $65/night) probably because it as out of season but given the quality of the hotel I would be prepared to pay more in future. Breakfast was very good and the selection was enormous. We particularly enjoyed having an early evening cocktail or two in one of the bars, a very pleasant experience. Thoroughly recommended!
reviews.title: Oasis of peace, calm and tranquility

likes.disliked: — Nowhere is walkable from hotel if you do want to leave

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pilgimage Village was amazing!!!! We stayed in a Villa Deluxe, which given the amount of space, was a bargain at $130/night. We had our own little villa, with its own little pool and porch. Truly, it was so wonderful.
reviews.title: Wonderful luxurious oasis!!!

likes.liked: — Villa was amazing, quiet and relaxing
likes.disliked: — The wifi was weak and needed more frequent shuttle

reviews.text: The staff was also incredible. They went out of their way to help us (including going down to the train station to get our tickets to Da Nang).
reviews.title: Great escape, but please keep the air-con on!

likes.liked: — The pool, the service, the cleanliness, the beautiful grounds.
likes.disliked: — Not having the air-con on in some areas.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The airport pickup worked out fine: they were on time
reviews.title: Absolutley top-notch!!

reviews.text: We stayed here for five days in February. The room was fabulous and very clean, and the grounds were fantastic. The day spa was lovely as well.
reviews.title: Divine Hotel but staff a little conspicious

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What I really loved was out little verandah, complete with a day bed. The pebble-feature shower was okay.
reviews.title: calm, beautiful and very romantic

reviews.text: My only complaint was the staff at dinner. They would position themselves very close to you and watch you while you ate, which was a bit off putting, especially when dining alone.
reviews.title: A beautiful hotel

reviews.text: We arrived in hue after a pretty frantic few weeks in cambodia and vietnam, hue is a quieter than hanoi and hcmc (obviously!!) this hotel whilst a little out of town is a great place for a pit stop, we stayed 4 nights and truely loved it.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel- great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we had a honeymoon bunglow which was huge! with a beautiful outdoor rain shower, deep sunken bath indoors and a private plunge pool. (ok so thats very toursity and not in keeping with the cultural part of the holiday)
reviews.title: Amazing Setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose Pilgrimage Village because we thought it would be nice to spend a bit more than usual and stay somewhere a bit more luxurious after a long overnight train trip - and this turned out to be a great idea! We hadn't asked for an early check in, so didn't expect our room to be ready when we arrived, but we were extremely pleased to find that it was, allowing us time to shower and then sit down and eat before taking the shuttle to town.
reviews.title: Wish we'd had more than one night

reviews.text: We chose one of the cheaper rooms, but it was absolutely fabulous - huge, with great amenities, and wonderfully silky bathrobes to lounge about in. The more expensive rooms must have been amazing!
reviews.title: Great resort hotelm a little out of town

likes.disliked: — LocatioN A BIT OUT OF TOWN

reviews.text: This was my first experience of staying in resort accommodation, and I have to say despite my snobbery about this kind of place, I really enjoyed it. I only wish that we had the opportunity to stay longer, as it would have been nice to have a chance to use the spa facilities.
reviews.title: Spectacular "wow" Resort

reviews.text: One of the positives about Pilgrimage Village was that it was away from the town, which does provide some relief from all the hassles that travelling in Vietnam can bring. But this can also be a negative, as it's not really the 'real' Vietnam.
reviews.title: Expectations delivered ...

likes.disliked: — Weather - it rains (heavily) in december and january

reviews.text: There must have been vast improvements in staffing from earlier reviews in mid 2007, as we had no problems communicating with staff, and found them all to be very curtious and helpful, and we don't have anything negative to say about Pilgrimage Village.
reviews.title: Ultra-luxe hotel away from downtown

reviews.text: Pilgrimage has amazing service, they always greet you at entrance and have good security, as the hotel is in a small village outside Hue.
reviews.title: Great place at good price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are great, they are very big, have big bathrooms with separate shower. The grounds are great, including 2 swimming pools. Breakfast was a little bit disapointing, it feels like a "canteen", its just too big and not reflecting the rest of the hotel. But overall would recommend it to anyone
reviews.title: Expensive - but you get what you pay for!

reviews.text: Yes, this place is as expensive as it gets in Vietnam. You do, however, get what you pay for. The atmosphere, service, rooms and amenities are first class and as good as you'll get anywhere in the world. We are a couple from London and very seasoned travellers, having stayed in multiple hotels of varying quality in different continents over the years, so we are not prone to hyperbole; bearing that in mind we both have to say that this place offers as good an experience as you will get at any 5 star resort/hotel anywhere. It is basically a luxury resort out of town (with regular hotel shuttle-buses into town) set in baeutiful gardens with lovely swimming pools, two restaurants and two bars. We booked a deluxe room and were upgraded to a honeymoon bungalow with its own balcony/terrace overlooking the gardens. The service is impeccable and everything works well. Staff all speak Engligh (unusual in this country) and are very helpful. You do have to pay through the nose for this though - $150 for a night's stay in a country where the average local daily wage is $1-2, but a very memorable experience.
reviews.title: Magic place to escape and simpy be . . . even for a few days

reviews.text: My friend & i stayed in Pilgrimage Village for 3 days in mid March, as a part of our prolonged Indochina trip. The hotel is a member of SLH group, which usually is a good sign. Booked it on-line without a problem. Pilgrimage Village is a beautiful, green & serene resort outside of Hue, which is a quiet town itself. We had a little bungalow with tastefully decorated spacious room, large bathroom area (there are no doors separating the bedroom & bathtoom areas; shower, bath & toilet are covered with curtains only, which was a bit uncomfortable as far as the toilet concerned). Plenty of space to put the luggage. The resort has very relaxed tranquil atmosphere, very well maintained grounds, with obvious attention to detail. The pool is large enough for swimming, modern & stylish; the gym is from stone age, but unless you are training for olympics it is not a necessity in a place like this. The small Yoga sala was amazing. Was practicing my yoga every morning, with no one passing by or disturbing within a hour. Only birds singing, fish jumping & velvet lotus flowers staying still in front of my eyes. Absolute Zen! Alternatively you can practice a free 30min thai-che session every morning in front of the pool with one of the spa-instructors .
reviews.title: Great place and great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a long water canal with lotus flowers, little gold fish & frogs. Lotuses are also planted in numerous water ponds around. The frogs around reception area make the funny barking-dog noises at night, a unique experience!
reviews.title: First class hotel

description: Pilgrimage Village is a traditional Vietnamese boutique resort blending harmoniously in the local environment. Set amidst lush green gardens and lily ponds, Pilgrimage Village is a haven, where the pace of life slows down… looking for lost time? Immerse yourself in a myriad of experiences from the luxurious naturally inspired spa treatments to Tai Chi, yoga or perhaps some chakra cleansing. A sanctuary for the mind, body and spirit. Relax, rejuvenate and revitalize.
